text: The following is a list of the 34 pinniped species–seals, sea lions, and the walrus–organized taxonomically. Information given from left to right is the common name; the scientific name; subspecies if any, the conservation status given by the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN)–and a link to their species page on the IUCN website which serves as a reference for all information–the current range, and an image. ==List== {| class="wikitable" width="100%" | colspan="5" align="center" bgcolor="pink"|Tribe Pinnipedia – 5 genera, 10 species |- |colspan="100%" align="center" bgcolor="#BBBBFF"|Family Phocidae {|class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%;text-align:center" !scope="col"|Common name !scope="col"|Scientific name !scope="col"|Subspecies !scope="col"|Conservation status !scope="col" class="unsortable"|Range !scope="col" class="unsortable"|Picture |- !scope="row"|Harbor seal |Phoca vitulina Linnaeus, 1758 | *P. v. vitulina East Atlantic harbor seal ; 62,500; *P. v. concolor West Atlantic harbor seal ; 60,000; *P. v. mellonae Freshwater seal ; 50; *P. v. richardii North Pacific harbor seal ; 190,000; *P. v. stejnegeri Kuril Island seal ; unknown; |;
